alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 7:41AM CST until March 01 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Cumberland River At Dover affecting Stewart County. For the Cumberland River...including Dover...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cumberland River At Dover. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 62.0 feet, Low lying agricultural areas along the river, adjacent tributaries, and river access points are inundated, including River Rd between Tom Earhart Rd and the Blue Creek Recreation Area boat ramp, Bellwood Branch Rd near Patricia Cir, Cub Creek Cove and the Commissay Hollow Accesss point, wildcat Creek Rd at Wildcat Creek, and Lee Hollow Rd at Dunaway Hollow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 62.6 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below 62.0 feet Tuesday morning. - Action stage is 62.0 feet. - Flood stage is 66.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 600 AM CST.
